bug.author: arnaudmiribel
bug.summary: Multiselect check for defaults goes wrong if not a list
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
When using st.multiselect(), there's an error being thrown out if default values are given in a tuple instead of a list. See additional info for a solution. I'm happy to do a PR if you're ok with my point. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Create an app.py with the following:
import streamlit as st INTENSITIES = ("a", "b", "c") st.multiselect( label="Choose among:", options=INTENSITIES, default=INTENSITIES, )
Now run streamlit run app.py.
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
The code above should work and print the following: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7164864/80595482-1b05a800-8a25-11ea-8764-20934e347c37.png></denchmark-link>
It does work if given list objects as in: st.multiselect( label="Choose among:", options=list(INTENSITIES), default=list(INTENSITIES), ) <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Error shows: StreamlitAPIException: Every Multiselect default value must exist in options <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
Not sure about this. Didn't try before. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.58.0 Python version: Python 3.6.9 :: Anaconda, Inc. Using Conda OS version: macOS Mojave 10.14.6 Browser version: Google Chrome 81.0.4044.92
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional info</denchmark-h>
Code responsible seems to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/blob/e1431cf04523a1e8f2a32eff1e223dae20219087/lib/streamlit/DeltaGenerator.py#L1685>be here</denchmark-link> when casting to list: <denchmark-code>if not isinstance(default_values, list): default_values = [default_values] </denchmark-code>
Should rather be: <denchmark-code>if not isinstance(default_values, list): default_values = list(default_values) </denchmark-code>
Otherwise, in the tuple case, ("a", "b", "c") is converted to [("a", "b", "c")] hence the error.

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/arnaudmiribel>@arnaudmiribel</denchmark-link> , thanks for reporting this! It looks like this is a simple oversight/bug, so please create a PR and we'll be happy to review it.
